results.title: Effect of eucalyptol on matrix metalloproteinase-9 and its tissue inhibitor in hypertensive rats
results.text_hl: Moreover, its combination with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ exerted more significant effects compared to each drug alone.

citations.NLM: Murad H. Effect of eucalyptol on matrix metalloproteinase-9 and its tissue inhibitor in hypertensive rats Bioinformation. 2023;19(5):562-564. PMID: 37886137
citations.BibTeX: @article{37886137, title={Effect of eucalyptol on matrix metalloproteinase-9 and its tissue inhibitor in hypertensive rats}, author={Murad H}, journal={Bioinformation}, volume={19}, number={5}, pages={562-564}}

results.title: Effects of nisoldipine and lisinopril on left ventricular mass and function in diabetic nephropathy.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: The 24-h diastolic @<m>DISEASE_Hematologic_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006402 @@@blood@@@ pressure was reduced from 83 to 80 mmHg in the @CHEMICAL_Nisoldipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015737 @@@nisoldipine@@@ group (P = 0.06) and from 85 to 80 mmHg in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ group (P = 0.02).

citations.NLM: Tarnow L, Sato A, Ali S, Rossing P, Nielsen FS, Parving HH. Effects of nisoldipine and lisinopril on left ventricular mass and function in diabetic nephropathy. Diabetes Care. 1999 Mar;22(3):491-4. PMID: 10097934
citations.BibTeX: @article{10097934, title={Effects of nisoldipine and lisinopril on left ventricular mass and function in diabetic nephropathy.}, author={Tarnow L and Sato A and Ali S and Rossing P and Nielsen FS and Parving HH}, journal={Diabetes Care}, volume={22}, number={3}, pages={491-4}}

results.title: A diuretic is more effective than a beta-blocker in hypertensive patients not controlled on amlodipine and lisinopril.
results.text_hl: The results show that in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ whose @<m>DISEASE_Hematologic_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006402 @@@blood@@@ pressures are not controlled by the combination of @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@, the addition of @CHEMICAL_Bendroflumethiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001539 @@@bendrofluazide@@@ 5 mg once daily causes a significant fall in @<m>DISEASE_Hematologic_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006402 @@@blood@@@ pressure compared with placebo and a significantly greater fall than 100 mg @CHEMICAL_Atenolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ once daily.

citations.NLM: Antonios TF, Cappuccio FP, Markandu ND, Sagnella GA, MacGregor GA. A diuretic is more effective than a beta-blocker in hypertensive patients not controlled on amlodipine and lisinopril. Hypertension. 1996 Jun;27(6):1325-8. PMID: 8641743
citations.BibTeX: @article{8641743, title={A diuretic is more effective than a beta-blocker in hypertensive patients not controlled on amlodipine and lisinopril.}, author={Antonios TF and Cappuccio FP and Markandu ND and Sagnella GA and MacGregor GA}, journal={Hypertension}, volume={27}, number={6}, pages={1325-8}}

results.title: Comparison of antihypertensive therapies by noninvasive techniques.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Atenolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ (n = 10) significantly decreased conventionally measured @<m>DISEASE_Hematologic_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006402 @@@blood@@@ pressure from 144/103 to 135/93 mm Hg and @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ (n = 9) from 150/104 to 130/92 mm Hg.

citations.NLM: Graettinger WF, Lipson JL, Klein RC, Cheung DG, Weber MA. Comparison of antihypertensive therapies by noninvasive techniques. Chest. 1989 Jul;96(1):74-9. PMID: 2544352
citations.BibTeX: @article{2544352, title={Comparison of antihypertensive therapies by noninvasive techniques.}, author={Graettinger WF and Lipson JL and Klein RC and Cheung DG and Weber MA}, journal={Chest}, volume={96}, number={1}, pages={74-9}}

results.title: Lisinopril reduces left ventricular hypertrophy and cardiac polyamine concentrations without a reduction in left ventricular wall stress in transgenic Tsukuba hypertensive mice.
results.text_hl: The left ventricular weight, left ventricular diameter, left ventricular wall stress, and left ventricular @CHEMICAL_Polyamines @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011073 @@@polyamine@@@ concentrations in the untreated group were significantly higher compared to those in the @CELLLINE_CVCL:C0MU @@@C57BL/6@@@ @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@. The @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ group had significantly decreased @<m>DISEASE_Hematologic_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006402 @@@systolic blood@@@ pressure and other measurement items, except the left ventricular wall stress, in comparison with the untreated group.

citations.NLM: Kai T, Ishikawa K. Lisinopril reduces left ventricular hypertrophy and cardiac polyamine concentrations without a reduction in left ventricular wall stress in transgenic Tsukuba hypertensive mice. Hypertens Res. 2000 Nov;23(6):625-31. PMID: 11131275
citations.BibTeX: @article{11131275, title={Lisinopril reduces left ventricular hypertrophy and cardiac polyamine concentrations without a reduction in left ventricular wall stress in transgenic Tsukuba hypertensive mice.}, author={Kai T and Ishikawa K}, journal={Hypertens Res}, volume={23}, number={6}, pages={625-31}}

results.title: Comparison of different fixed antihypertensive combination drugs: a double-blind, placebo-controlled parallel group study.
results.text_hl: Normalization of @<m>DISEASE_Hematologic_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006402 @@@blood@@@ pressure (DBP < 90 mmHg) was observed in 48% of @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with sustained-release @CHEMICAL_Verapamil @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014700 @@@verapamil@@@/@CHEMICAL_trandolapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:C052035 @@@trandolapril@@@, in 46% with @CHEMICAL_Atenolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@/@CHEMICAL_Chlorthalidone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002752 @@@chlorthalidone@@@ and in 40% with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@/@CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@hydrochlorothiazide@@@.

citations.NLM: de Leeuw PW, Notter T, Zilles P. Comparison of different fixed antihypertensive combination drugs: a double-blind, placebo-controlled parallel group study. J Hypertens. 1997 Jan;15(1):87-91. PMID: 9050975
citations.BibTeX: @article{9050975, title={Comparison of different fixed antihypertensive combination drugs: a double-blind, placebo-controlled parallel group study.}, author={de Leeuw PW and Notter T and Zilles P}, journal={J Hypertens}, volume={15}, number={1}, pages={87-91}}

results.title: Angiotensin-(1-7) contributes to the antihypertensive effects of blockade of the renin-angiotensin system.
results.text_hl: Intravenous administration of @CHEMICAL_CGS_24592 @CHEMICAL_MESH:C086164 @@@CGS 24592@@@ (30 mg/kg) to @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ in which @<m>DISEASE_Hematologic_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006402 @@@blood@@@ pressure was normalized by 9 days of therapy with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@ elicited an elevation of mean arterial pressure that was sustained throughout the infusion period and for 20 minutes thereafter.

citations.NLM: Iyer SN, Ferrario CM, Chappell MC. Angiotensin-(1-7) contributes to the antihypertensive effects of blockade of the renin-angiotensin system. Hypertension. 1998 Jan;31(1 Pt 2):356-61. PMID: 9453328
citations.BibTeX: @article{9453328, title={Angiotensin-(1-7) contributes to the antihypertensive effects of blockade of the renin-angiotensin system.}, author={Iyer SN and Ferrario CM and Chappell MC}, journal={Hypertension}, volume={31}, number={1 Pt 2}, pages={356-61}}

results.title: Which anti-hypertensive to add to a beta-blocker: ACE inhibitor or diuretic?
results.text_hl: Eight weeks' treatment with the combination of ACE inhibitor and beta-blocker or the diuretic and beta-blocker produced falls in @<m>DISEASE_Hematologic_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006402 @@@blood@@@ pressure (lying: -8.4 +/- 15.4/ -7.3 +/- 80 mmHg and -6.1 +/- 15.3/ -5.2 +/- 8.8 mmHg [mean +/- SD] for @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@hydrochlorothiazide@@@ respectively; standing: -10.2 +/- 14.2/8.2 +/- 9.2 mmHg and -6.8 +/- 14/ -6.3 +/- 10.3 mmHg for @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@hydrochlorothiazide@@@ respectively) which were not statistically significantly different.

citations.NLM: Huttunen M, Lampainen E, Lilja M, Ikäheimo M, Kontro J, Mäkynen P, Savolainen A. Which anti-hypertensive to add to a beta-blocker: ACE inhibitor or diuretic? J Hum Hypertens. 1992 Apr;6(2):121-5. PMID: 1350796
citations.BibTeX: @article{1350796, title={Which anti-hypertensive to add to a beta-blocker: ACE inhibitor or diuretic?}, author={Huttunen M and Lampainen E and Lilja M and Ikäheimo M and Kontro J and Mäkynen P and Savolainen A}, journal={J Hum Hypertens}, volume={6}, number={2}, pages={121-5}}
